I ain't updaated f'month!

Oh well. I do have quite a lot to say. Probably none of it at all interesting to any one else. But i guess that hasn't stopped me int' past. But.... i shall restrain myself from such idle discourse. Maybe another day.

However, i will say one thing which brought me much myrth. teeehhee. hehe. I got an email from a (reasonably well-known as further research has informed me) journalist from the Mail on Sunday [1], in responce to my appeal i had put on the York Alumni website ( http://www.york.ac.uk/admin/dao/alumni/events.htm -see bottom). He told me all about his radical Marxist activities of the early 70s etc etc and i found an article about him on the web that says he once said to his lecturer "Sorry I'm late, i was starting the reveloution". Now he backs the death penalty and according to one site is a "moral Conservative". hahahahaha. My favourite bit of all, especially as he hadn't mentioned his Toryfication, and there was all this Trot-talk and his (then) views, especially about Trade Unionism and other revelutionary politics, at the bottom you get the disclaimer "The views expressed in the email may not reflect the opinions of the Mail on Sunday or associated newspapers". hhahahahahahahahahahahahahahahahahahahahahaha!!!!!!

Well it amused me anyway........ Bonne Nuit tout la monde! Bed time! (boing!)

[1] for my non-British readers, or those with better things to do with their time than mock/be amused by newspapers, the Mail is a right-wing tabloid, with views that would be almost comedic if they were not possessed by real people!

Because a woman's work is never done. and is underpaid, or unpaid, or boring, or repetitious, and we're the first to get fired, and what we look like is more important than what we do. And if we get raped its our fault and if we get beaten we must have provoked it and if we raise our voices we're nagging bitches and if we enjoy sex we're nymphos and if we don't we're frigid and if we love women it's because we can't get a real man and if we ask our doctor too many questions we're nuerotic or pushy and if we expect childcare we're selfish and if we stand up for our rights we're agressive and un-feminine and if we don't we're typical weak females and if we want to get married we're out to trap a man and if we don't we're unnatural and because we still can't get an adequate, safe contraceptive, but men can walk on the moon and if we can't cope or don't want a pregnancy we're made to feel guilty about abortion and for lots and lots of other reasons we are part of the women's liberation movement... yes so student union elections on campus today- i'm standing for women's commitee. Nervous. I don't think there is much competition as far as know, but still scared shitless. I hate standing for election. Also- Unity (unite against fascism) event tonight. Video showing. Am very very nervous because technology hates me. Drempt last night that i showed the wrong film and lots of old women laughed at me. Hmmmmppph. Showing "Youn Nazi and Proud" along with the other video i tried to show a few weeks ago and fucked up. I have to go to campus in a minute to by copius amounts os crisps and biscuits as i have bribed the ever-hungry student population to come with promise of free junk food.

Went to a political meeting tonight with Lindsey German (convenor of stop the war coalition) and Azmat Begg, father of Moazzam Begg, A Briton  who is currently being held at Guantamino Bay, without charge or trial. A story about it is here:  http://www.f-t-a.freeserve.co.uk/potm/2003/apr.htm  (but there are plenty on the web- just type in his name!)
but in short he was living in Afghanistan doing charity work and when the bombing started he took his family over to Pakistan for safety and he was arrested in the middle of the night, in front of his 6-year-old daughter, and bundled into the boot of a car where he managed to phone his dad from his mobile, but then he was put into solitary confinment for a year and then moved to Gutamino Bay where he has been mistreated. Although it is a US base- it is up to the UK governemt to release him. Grrrrrrrr..... i spoke to his dad afterwards and he is really keen for people t write to their MPs and i have never got around to doing that. But this time i will *nods* as it has really upset/angered me!

Also- eeeeeeeeek! Pete had his hair cut!!!!! He no longer looks like a scary cross between Anne Widocome and Pat Sharpe!

due to the late hour this will just be a quick update.
Firstly i wish to apologise for the incredably self-pitying rant i had yesterday. Sorry sorry sorry *ducks Myf*. When i feel down i usually tryt and keep it to myself but then sometimes there are so many things at once it all strats pouring out. Which is what happened. So sorry. And you were lovely to me. So thanks.

Secondly- i have been very studenty this evening. After a meeting, several other people and i ordered an Indian take-away. This boy james and i shared a veggie korma but had no cutlery so sat on vanburgh Stalls (a porters' lodge/college reception) eating it with the lid of the packet it came in. Then we found the rice that had been seperated. So this girl Leah (who i don't know that well even) walked back to my house, through the allotments, eating the rice and when we got to my house we made some more and ate her korma and watched Blackadder! hehehe. 

Thirdly- it was my friend Alex's (stupid_alex)birthday! I think he is the first friend from school who i am still friends with who has turned 21! Scary! 15 years ago- maybe even to the day- i went to his birthday party dressed as Burgler Bill. Does anyone else remember that ()the book i mean, not the party)? i feel so old!

Fourthly- i was being narcissistic and also procrastinating, and typed my name into google and found some emensly funny things. I think that Alex (penwing) is the only person i can think of who would find it as funny, but i was being discussed on an SU hacks message board around the time of the conference elections. They wondered what my political alliences were and Iain Lindley (now the youngest tory counciller in the country!) decided that i was "non-party aligned left-winger". although "Her running mate Siobhan is a member of SWSS but failed to get elected; whether Anna will support CFE/SBL or SWSS/FOSIS I have no idea.". hahahahaha. But Dave Sammels (another tory- trying to climb up the young conservative (probably literally) ooops i mean 'Conservative Future')proclained 'Anna is a member of Stuydent broad Left'. No i'm not! Made me laugh all day. Had my faction described as 'YorkSAW' (York Students Agaibst War)- WTF!? There was also a commentery and break down of votes with gems like 'With O'Gorman's [shiv's] impending elimination there were 7 candidates fighting for 4 places, with very little separating any:.......As expected the lion's share of the surplus went to fellow YorkSAW member Liddle, catapulting her up into a more secure position. This left McCarthy next for the chop; with her having no obvious places to transfer, this round could have had a large and random bearing on what would follow..."! Ha! why do they care so much!? It was just NUS crap! hehehe- descibed as "the left" in vote break downs. LOSERS!!! *pretends she has not spent all day looking at the message board and wetting herself laughing*
sorry everyone- that isn't particularly interesting. 

Alex (ax_deadparrot) just came and told me off for being 'up past my bedtime'. he can be scary. I must go.

God- just been in floads of tears in a film "Land and Freedom" by Ken Loach about the Spanish Civil War (http://www.imdb.com/title/tt0114671/). I never cry in films (except in Billy Elliott when his dad has to break the strike- although when i mentioned this to Catherine she said 'Anna- you are weird. You should cry in films about fluffy animals and little children, not politics'- but to be honest i don't give a shit about fluffy animals and little children even though I know she was joking). I may just go and try and phone Shiv. I know she will understand my post Land and Freedom blues. And i need to find out why she didn't come anyway..... .....well just phoned shiv. didn't talk for very long- she needed a wee- but i feel a bit better. Oh how i cried through that film. I am normally too stubbon to cry in films. I think "aah this has been manafactured to make me cry- so i shall not" but i couldn't help it in this one. I think it is the first one i have cried through. But it wasn't just at the film. Quite a lot of it was through guilt as i am such i fucking apathast who has done NOTHING for the anti-facist movement and anti-war movements, I can't even get a video to work properly. I haven't done anything at all. But crying about it isn't really going to help. But it makes me feel so incredably guilty and powerless. I am so useless. :-( and watching that made me think of all the people being killed in Fulluja by people represnting our country, and the Red Creasnt not even being allowed in, and how awfully fascit the army is as even if the soliders for some reason tried to leave they cpuld be tried for it. I am so lazy. It also made me feel so proud of my gran too, all the work she has done for socailism and anti-facism. She protested about the Black Shirts coming down Kable Street as a teenager in 1936 and i bet i wouldn't have the balls as i am such a wimp. She and my Grandad had police threaten them with trunchans, and that has never happened to me. Does this mean i don't care enough? I've actually had police ask me if i was ok and to let them know if i had problems when protesting on Hiroshma day a few years ago. I think my Gran and Grandad, about my age, cowering in a shop doorway from fascits is one of the romantic things i have ever heard. This is becasue i am odd. Also it had the most uncharacteristic effect on me to want left-wing love. How lovely would it be to share you love with someone who also shared such a huge passion for what you believed in, and struggled together? This film has weird effects on me, Probably won't last long. But doing this dissertation on student protest movemnts will make me feel so awful and lazy and apathetic. I really wish more people cared so we could work together and make changes. Not overthrow a govenment or anthing like that, as i really don't think i've got it in me and not sure if i would really want to, but just little things. I think i am going to phone my gran tomorrow. I really miss her. I wish i could talk to my dad about the film and stuff but i can't as oter peopple would get in the way and i just want to be able to talk to him on my own, even on the phone and feel like he is mine. Just for a very little time and not have to share him. There is so much i want, but will never have, becasue life sucks so much. People go. also people just don't care about things and watch them go by and don't DO anyrhing when they can. People also don't appriciate what the have got. Maybe going to that film wasn't the best idea, eh? But i need to make myself get out, even of it is going to depress me as i am finding it quite difficult to go out. It is weord i keep having mood swings and sometimes don't want to leave the house and i have to make myself. Don't know why though. it isn't as though i am wonderfully happy in here. I also kind of feel myself pushing people away and i don't know why. especially people i am close too. Feel weirdly disembodied alot of the time, almos disconnected and things are happening and i am jsut watching and it isn't really my life and things are going so quickly and i don't understand anything. On a lighter note- my desk lamp smells like melting marshmellow and i am not sure why. yumyum.
